Articles.Content:
So i get that a "fly by" doesn't have to achieve orbit but can i complete a flyby contract if i make orbit?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-24T04:52:13Z" title="06/24/2015 04:52  AM" data-short="9 yr">June 24, 2015</time> by aleis**

Yes, you can.

In fact, you will complete the 'fly by' conditions of a contract as soon as you enter the SoI of the target body, regardless of what you do next.

I've seen a youtuber who didn't get his contract fulfilled just by entering the SoI. At the time he was on a collision course with the Mun, and smacked his craft right into it.

On his second attempt, this time with a proper trajectory, he *did* get the contract completion as soon as he entered the SoI. It appears that you do at least have to have a proper flyby trajectory at the time of entering.

This might also explain why I have seen people report that they have successfully flow by an object without getting a contract completion. They might have had an invalid (colliding) trajectory upon entering the SoI, which they then manually corrected, but the trigger opportunity had already passed.

> 
> Yes, you can.
> In fact, you will complete the 'fly by' conditions of a contract as soon as you enter the SoI of the target body, regardless of what you do next.

The other day I had a tourist who needed to fly by Mun and Minmus. So I planned a trip where the ship entered orbit with the Mun, and later orbited Minmus. I was expecting orbiting both to be enough bacon for trigging the requirements for the contract.

But it didn't. Orbiting Mun did in fact fulfilled the fly-by the Mun part. But no matter how many orbits I let the ship do on Minmus, the fly-by Minmus part didn't check positively.

How's that?
